content:
Diagnosis:
Transverse colon adenocarcinoma arising from serrated adenoma
Endoscopic mucosal resection performed 15 April 2024 by Dr [redacted name]

Histology:
Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma arising within serrated adenoma
pTisN0M0
KRAS G12C mutation detected
BRAF wild-type
Complete excision with clear margins

Previous medical history:
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension

Current medications:
Metformin 1g BD
Ramipril 5mg OD

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
First oncology review following EMR

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent endoscopic mucosal resection of a transverse colon polyp which showed unexpected focus of adenocarcinoma. The procedure was uncomplicated and he has recovered well with no ongoing symptoms. His bowel function has returned to normal and he reports good appetite and stable weight.

On examination, he is well with normal vital signs. Abdomen is soft and non-tender with well-healed port sites. No concerning clinical findings.

I have reviewed the histology which confirms pTis disease with complete excision and clear margins. Given the early stage, no adjuvant treatment is required. We have discussed surveillance strategy including repeat colonoscopy in 12 months. CT chest/abdomen/pelvis has been arranged for baseline staging.

Plan is for clinical review in 3 months with CT results. [redacted name] understands to contact us sooner if any new symptoms develop.
